text: Steven Ronald Bochco (December 16, 1943 - April 1, 2018) was an American television producer and writer. He created a number of popular television hits including Hill Street Blues, L.A. Law, Doogie Howser, M.D., and NYPD Blue. He also had unsuccessful series including Cop Rock. He won Emmy Awards for his writing in 1981 and 1987. Bochco was diagnosed with leukemia in 2014. He died from the disease at his home in Los Angeles, California on April 1, 2018, at age 74. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1943 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:American television producers Category:American television writers Category:Writers from New York City Category:Jewish American writers Category:Deaths from leukemia
title: Steven Bochco
